meanings.definition: The process of managing or running something principally for financial gain.
meanings.sent1: The commercialization of the new toy line brought in a lot of money for the company.
meanings.sent2: The commercialization of the latest smartphone model led to increased sales.
meanings.sent3: The commercialization of the pet rock craze made many people laugh at the absurdity.
meanings.sent4: The commercialization of education turns students into customers and teachers into salespeople.
meanings.sent5: The commercialization of the music industry turned artists into products to be sold.

meanings.definition: The act of introducing a new product or service to the market for profit.
meanings.sent1: The commercialization of the innovative gadget was a success in the market.
meanings.sent2: The commercialization of the new software attracted many customers.
meanings.sent3: The commercialization of the self-cleaning shoes made everyone want a pair.
meanings.sent4: The commercialization of the virtual reality experience transported users to new worlds.
meanings.sent5: The commercialization of the health drink promised a healthier lifestyle to consumers.
